body_html:
@m3bm3b thank you for the comments! i'll be addressing them, and at first I also wanted to call this a Notification but -- because it has no "state" (even a resettable one). Though what you said does make me wonder if I should change the interface and replace the "Notify" op (which does an atomic notify and then resets the notification state) with two ops: "Notify" and "Reset". I'll also update the documentation based on what you suggested.

In terms of usage examples, mine are experimental. However, @benoitsteiner, @alextp, @saeta, @asimshankar, and @sguada may be interested in at least the cancellable timing functionality.

In terms of usage examples, mine are experimental.  However, @benoitsteiner, @alextp, @saeta, @asimshankar, and @sguada may be interested in at least the cancellable timing functionality.
body:
@m3bm3b thank you for the comments!  i'll be addressing them, and at first I also wanted to call this a Notification but -- because it has no "state" (even a resettable one).  Though what you said does make me wonder if I should change the interface and replace the "Notify" op (which does an atomic notify and then resets the notification state) with two ops: "Notify" and "Reset".  I'll also update the documentation based on what you suggested.

In terms of usage examples, mine are experimental.  However, @benoitsteiner, @alextp, @saeta, @asimshankar, and @sguada may be interested in at least the cancellable timing functionality.
